item.title: Vitalik on Wordcels, liberalism, and more

vitalik.eth on Twitter

‚Äú1. Thinking about this tweet lately. Here we have someone with a ‚Äútech people vs word people‚Äù dichotomy, but unlike @balajis and all the others who do this, crypto ends up on the side of... the word people. This is not my image of what crypto is! So what‚Äôs going on? https://t.co/g8y9mQruNi‚Äù

Glenn Greenwald on Twitter

item.description:
SFBART on Twitter

‚ÄúIt didn‚Äôt take 20 years to build a single restroom. Underground restrooms were closed for 20 years due to security concerns after 9/11. Yes, this was not a joke. It was a frequent request from riders for many years, and they should know it is now open for the public. https://t.co/W1oyD17FiL‚Äù

item.title: The end of two globalizations
item.description:
It seems increasingly possible that the curtain is coming down on the great age of global economic integration which began in the decades following the second world war and then accelerated dramatically in the 1990s. It remains to be seen just how deep and long-lasting a retreat is on the cards. Whether we‚Äôre in for more of a gentle retrenchment or a dr‚Ä¶

item.title: Talking "Bretbug" in the Classroom
item.description:
I taught the Bretbug case in my strategic political communication class this week. It‚Äôs weird teaching a case study where you‚Äôre the main protagonist. But it would be weirder not to teach it, I think. The Bretbug episode hits right at the center of a few themes from my class. It‚Äôs a classic example of ‚Äúconflict expansion.‚Äù It illustrates the way that in‚Ä¶

URL: https://davekarpf.substack.com/p/talking-bretbug-in-the-classroom?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: Dan Luu
item.description:
Dan Luu on Twitter

‚ÄúOne thing it took me quite a while to understand is how few bits of information it‚Äôs possible to reliably convey to a large number of people. When I was at MS, I remember initially being surprised at how unnuanced their communication was, but it really makes sense in hindsight.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/danluu/status/1487228574608211969

source: Best of Twitter - Week of January 23, 2022

item.title: Dan Luu
item.description:
Dan Luu on Twitter

‚ÄúThe fear was that if they said that they needed to ship fast and improve reliability, reliability would be used as an excuse to not ship quickly and needing to ship quickly would be used as an excuse for poor reliability and they‚Äôd achieve none of their goals.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/danluu/status/1487228578131447809

source: Best of Twitter - Week of January 23, 2022

item.title: Dan Luu
item.description:
Dan Luu on Twitter

‚ÄúI‚Äôve seen quite a few people in upper management attempt to convey a mixed/nuanced message since my time at MS and I have yet to observe a case of this working in a major org at a large company (I have seen this work at a startup, but that‚Äôs a very different environment).‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/danluu/status/1487228580517998592

source: Best of Twitter - Week of January 23, 2022
